attributes.review: to understand my frustrations with this app we must first begin when i was a young child. i grew up with the usual family set up: my mom was a penguin and my dad was a seagull. making me, a pengull. i had the happiest of childhoods until i finally realized something insane. i could fly. now i know what you all must be thinking “aren’t you part penguin? penguins don’t fly silly goose!” and to that i say “ i’m not a goose!!!” anyways my first time flying was incredible!! i absolutely loved every second of it. i felt free and happy and content with my life. it seemed as if the world was finally making sense to me. now you might be wondering, “what is this stupid bird talking about and why is it related to this app?” and to that i respond “i’m not stupid!!” but also”i’m getting there”. one day i stumbled across a beautiful ostrich named Comic Sans. she was beautiful, it truly was love at first sight. i cherished every waking moment i had with her. i loved her so deeply and so profoundly that i can’t imagine loving another being as much as i loved her. but alas, my age span (though widely debated) is roughly immortal. an ostrich’s isn’t. i knew that one day i was going to part with my beautiful Comic Sans. and that day came out on the day this app was released. not only did i think this was an app for trumpets to cheer me up after the passing of loved one, but it also brought back my hatred for ill designed app construction. there’s nothing i hate more than a glitchy app. there are so many bugs even i wouldn’t eat them. anyways. i hope that nobody downloads this app for the same reasons as myself. it won’t help you and i stead will leave you with gastrointestinal problems and projectile diarrhea.
attributes.title: HORRENDOUS APP
